title: FF Dax
content:
Good Evening fellow people.

I'm a student and need a little assistance.  
In current brief I have been set out to find examples of where this typeface has been used.

I have found the common Morrisons offers and Ups logo, and also the recent Don't Blink campain in this months Focus mag. But I was wondering if anyone knew of a higher level of design it has been put into. If it be the main face or a subordinate face.

Many Thanks in advance, and I look forward to your replies.

Ash
author: adnewall

comments.content:
[This Flickr set could help you](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216003303/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/fontshop/sets/72157604227811502/ "FF Dax in use"). See also [FF Daxline in use](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216003303/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/fontshop/sets/72157604233846073/).  
[Btw., here’s an older [article about FF Dax](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216003303/http:/www.fontwerk.com/511/dax-die-neue-meta/) in German]

You'll find more examples here: [http://www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20dax](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216003303/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20dax "http://www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20dax")

Also the UPS font is a pretty blatant "homage" to Dax.

The German sports publishing house Philippka-Sportverlag uses FF Dax as the main face for several magazines it publishes, most notably "fullballtraining", the official magazine for coaches by the German Football Federation:

[http://www.philippka.de/front\_content.php?idcat=19](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216003303/http:/www.philippka.de/front_content.php?idcat=19 "http://www.philippka.de/front\_content.php?idcat=19")

Thanks alot guys, you've helped loads :D

Cheers again,  
ash
